intro: Adenoncos virens, commonly known as the green adenoncos, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Adenoncos virens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with partial shade.
